content:
What are the names of 5 bird species that are commonly found in forests and their respective scientific names stored in a SQL database using the following table structure:
Table Name: BirdSpecies
Columns: 
- SpeciesId (int, primary key)
- CommonName (varchar)
- ScientificName (varchar)
- Habitat (varchar)
- ConservationStatus (varchar)
Note: The data should be presented using the [HTML unordered list] data format.

Certainly! Below is an example of how you might store data for five bird species commonly found in forests in the specified SQL database table structure, presented in HTML unordered list format: ```html
  • SpeciesId: 1
    • CommonName: Scarlet Macaw
    • ScientificName: Ara macao
    • Habitat: Forest
    • ConservationStatus: Least Concern
  • SpeciesId: 2
    • CommonName: Great Horned Owl
    • ScientificName: Bubo virginianus
    • Habitat: Forest
    • ConservationStatus: Least Concern
  • SpeciesId: 3
    • CommonName: Indian Peafowl
    • ScientificName: Pavo cristatus
    • Habitat: Forest
    • ConservationStatus: Least Concern
  • SpeciesId: 4
    • CommonName: Northern Goshawk
    • ScientificName: Accipiter gentilis
    • Habitat: Forest
    • ConservationStatus: Least Concern
  • SpeciesId: 5
    • CommonName: Spotted Owl
    • ScientificName: Strix occidentalis
    • Habitat: Forest
    • ConservationStatus: Near Threatened
``` These examples represent bird species that are typically found in forest habitats, along with their common and scientific names, conservation status, and identification numbers for use in a database.
